label: Retail
description: Businesses selling finished goods directly to consumers through physical stores, digital channels, or hybrid models, characterized by high SKU counts, rapid product turnover, and seasonal collections.
characteristics: High SKU counts (5,000-100,000+ items per retailer)
High seasonality (25-40% annual sales in Q4)
Markdown pressure ($300B annual US losses, 15-20% of sales)
Omnichannel complexity (60-70% research online, buy in-store or vice versa)
Personalization imperative (71% consumers expect it, drives 10-30% revenue lift)
segments: Department Stores (Macy's, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's) - Multi-brand, large format, declining traffic
Specialty Apparel (Gap, Zara, H&M, Foot Locker) - Fast fashion, size/color complexity, trend-driven
Luxury Retail (Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Tiffany) - High-touch service, clienteling, limited distribution
Big-Box Retail (Target, Walmart, Costco) - High volume, operational efficiency, private label
Direct-to-Consumer/DTC (Warby Parker, Allbirds, Casper) - Digital-first, owned customer data
Off-Price Retail (TJ Maxx, Ross, Nordstrom Rack) - Opportunistic buying, treasure hunt experience

stats.inventoryAccuracy: 85-92% typical (causes 10-15% lost sales from phantom inventory)
